Below Average.name: Single-Leg Stand
Below Average.description: Try standing on one leg for 10–20 seconds. Switch legs and repeat 3 times. It's a great way to improve your balance!

Below Average.name: Heel-to-Toe Walk
Below Average.description: Walk in a straight line, placing your heel right in front of your toe for 5–10 steps. This helps with coordination and balance.

Average.name: Single-Leg Stand
Average.description: Stand on one leg for 15–30 seconds, then switch legs. Repeat 3 times. This exercise is perfect for enhancing your balance.

Average.name: Heel-to-Toe Walk
Average.description: Walk in a straight line, placing your heel right in front of your toe for 10–20 steps. It's a fun way to improve your coordination.

Average.name: Standing March
Average.description: March in place, lifting your knees high for 1–2 minutes. It's a great way to get your blood flowing and improve balance.

Above Average.name: Single-Leg Stand
Above Average.description: Stand on one leg for 30–40 seconds, then switch legs. Repeat 3 times. Challenge yourself and see how long you can balance!

Above Average.name: Heel-to-Toe Walk
Above Average.description: Walk in a straight line, placing your heel right in front of your toe for 20–30 steps. It's a great way to test your coordination.

Above Average.name: Yoga Poses
Above Average.description: Try Tree Pose and Warrior III. These poses are excellent for balance and focus. Enjoy the calm and strength they bring!
